tasks: Create a low-fidelity wireframe of your current portfolio's navigation system using the 8-point grid system, focusing on improving its usability. (Reference: https://lawsofux.com/8-point-grid-system) Score improvement needed for Collaboration & Communication: +2%

Write down 3 specific pain points you've encountered while working with designers or stakeholders in your current role, using the Jobs-to-be-Done framework to analyze them. (Reference: https://nngroup.com/articles/ten-usability-heuristics/) Score improvement needed for Collaboration & Communication: +2%

Develop a list of 5 questions to ask your colleagues about their design process and pain points during collaboration meetings, aiming to improve communication and understanding. (Reference: https://lawsofux.com/aesthetic-usability-effect) Score improvement needed for Collaboration & Communication: +1%

Create a user persona for your current design projects using Tesler's Law as a guide, focusing on understanding users' needs and behaviors. (Reference: https://lawsofux.com/teslers-law) Score improvement needed for Product Thinking & Strategy: +4%

Redesign the navigation menu of a fictional e-commerce website using Hick's Law to optimize its usability, aiming to reduce cognitive load. (Reference: https://lawsofux.com/hicks-law/) Score improvement needed for UI Craft & Visual Design: +3%

Develop a list of 5 possible solutions to a common design problem you've encountered in your current role, using the 10 Usability Heuristics as a guide. (Reference: https://nngroup.com/articles/ten-usability-heuristics/) Score improvement needed for Product Thinking & Strategy: +3%

Create a case study of a successful design project you've worked on, using the Laws of UX as a guide to analyze its strengths and weaknesses. (Reference: https://lawsofux.com/) Score improvement needed for Product Thinking & Strategy: +5%

Develop a list of 3 key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success of your design projects, focusing on user engagement and satisfaction. (Reference: https://nngroup.com/articles/ten-usability-heuristics/) Score improvement needed for Collaboration & Communication: +4%

Create a wireframe of an error state page using Aesthetic-Usability Effect as a guide to improve its visual appeal and usability. (Reference: https://lawsofux.com/aesthetic-usability-effect) Score improvement needed for UI Craft & Visual Design: +5%

Develop a comprehensive design strategy document outlining your approach to designing user-centered products, using the Laws of UX as a guide. (Reference: https://lawsofux.com/) Score improvement needed for Product Thinking & Strategy: +8%

Create a prototype of a new design concept using user research and validation methods to test its usability and effectiveness. (Reference: https://nngroup.com/articles/ten-usability-heuristics/) Score improvement needed for UI Craft & Visual Design: +7%

Conduct a peer review of your portfolio's navigation system, providing constructive feedback on usability and design quality using the 8-point grid system as a guide. (Reference: https://lawsofux.com/8-point-grid-system) Score improvement needed for Collaboration & Communication: +6%

resources.readup: As a Practitioner UX designer, you have the potential to unlock innovative solutions and create seamless user experiences. By focusing on building your skills in UX Fundamentals, UI Craft & Visual Design, User Research & Validation, Product Thinking & Strategy, and Collaboration & Communication, you can elevate your practice and drive meaningful impact in your work.

resources.title: 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design
resources.description: 7 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design ================================================= Jakob Nielsen ![](https://media.nngroup.com/medi...

topics.name: Applying Hick’s Law to Improve Navigation
topics.summary: Mastering the concept of Hick's Law will help Practitioner designers optimize navigation and reduce cognitive load for users.
practice_points: Analyze 3 existing websites using Hick’s Law and identify areas for improvement. Document findings in a report.
Design and test 2 new navigation systems with optimized button sizes and spacing. Conduct A/B testing to validate results.

topics.name: Developing a Comprehensive Style Guide
topics.summary: Creating a style guide will help Practitioner designers establish consistency in their design work and ensure user experience is aligned with the product's overall strategy.
practice_points: Research 5 existing style guides (e.g., Apple, Google, Microsoft) and identify common patterns and best practices. Create a list of recommendations for improvement.

topics.name: Conducting User Research Using the Jobs-to-be-Done Framework
topics.summary: Applying the Jobs-to-be-Done framework will enable Practitioner designers to gain a deeper understanding of users' motivations and behaviors, leading to more effective design solutions.
practice_points: Conduct 2 user interviews using the Jobs-to-be-Done framework. Document findings in a report and identify areas for further research.
